text:
For tests where configure needs to run executables you will need to prepare the
configure cache (config.site or whatever) beforehand with the correct results
for the target; the above results are expected.  Are there cases where this is
not possible?

creator: weigelt@metux.de
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> For tests where configure needs to run executables you will need to prepare the
> configure cache (config.site or whatever) beforehand with the correct results
> for the target; the above results are expected.  Are there cases where this is
> not possible?

Bad idea. Requires really much maintenance work to do this for every single
package. Unless there is an real standard for system wide database, we need to
get completely around this. 

I'm now going this way:

http://unitool.metux.de/index.php/System_properties

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Well, the use of $CONFIG_SITE/config.site is standardised and accepted by every
configure script; cache variable naming is also standardised.  Yes, you have to
go to some extra work for each configure script for package-specific cache
variables.  

Unless there are specific issues here there's not really any point filing bugs.
